findings.title: Missing robots.txt file
findings.description: No robots.txt file exists in the project root. This file is essential for search engine crawlers to understand which pages to index and crawl.
findings.impact: Search engines may not efficiently crawl the site, potentially missing important pages or wasting crawl budget on unimportant resources. This can significantly reduce discoverability.
findings.remediation: Create a robots.txt file in the public directory (or root for static deployment) with appropriate directives
findings.recommended_implementation:
User-agent: *
Allow: /
Sitemap: https://truthhunters.example.com/sitemap.xml

# Block admin/internal paths if any
Disallow: /admin/
Disallow: /*.json$
Disallow: /firebase.json

findings.title: Missing sitemap.xml file
findings.description: No XML sitemap exists. Sitemaps help search engines discover and index all important pages on the site.
findings.impact: Search engines may miss pages, resulting in incomplete indexing. This is especially critical for single-page applications where dynamic routes may not be discoverable through crawling alone.
findings.remediation: Create a sitemap.xml file listing all important URLs with appropriate priority and change frequency

findings.title: Missing Open Graph image (og:image)
findings.description: No og:image meta tag is present. This is the most critical Open Graph tag for social media sharing visibility.
findings.impact: When shared on social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Slack, Discord, etc.), the link will appear without an image, resulting in significantly lower click-through rates (CTR can drop by 30-50% without images).
findings.remediation: Add og:image meta tag with a high-quality preview image (1200x630px recommended)
findings.recommended_implementation:
<meta property="og:image" content="https://truthhunters.example.com/og-image.png">
<meta property="og:image:width" content="1200">
<meta property="og:image:height" content="630">
<meta property="og:image:alt" content="Truth Hunters: The Calibration Game - A research-backed educational game for middle schoolers">
<meta property="og:image:type" content="image/png">
findings.code_snippet:
<!-- Current: Missing -->
<!-- Lines 17-25 in index.html -->
<meta property="og:type" content="website">
<meta property="og:title" content="Truth Hunters: The Calibration Game">
<meta property="og:description" content="A research-backed educational game for middle schoolers to develop critical thinking and AI misinformation detection skills.">
<meta property="og:site_name" content="Truth Hunters">

findings.title: Missing og:url meta tag
findings.description: No og:url meta tag is present. This tag specifies the canonical URL for social sharing.
findings.impact: Social media platforms may use incorrect URLs when sharing, leading to fragmented social engagement metrics and duplicate content issues.
findings.remediation: Add og:url meta tag with the canonical URL of the application

findings.title: Twitter Card uses 'summary' instead of 'summary_large_image'
findings.description: Twitter card is set to 'summary' which displays a small image. 'summary_large_image' would provide better visibility.
findings.impact: Smaller preview on Twitter/X, resulting in lower engagement and click-through rates.
findings.remediation: Change to 'summary_large_image' and add twitter:image tag
findings.recommended_implementation:
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image">
<meta name="twitter:title" content="Truth Hunters: The Calibration Game">
<meta name="twitter:description" content="Learn to spot AI misinformation and calibrate your confidence.">
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://truthhunters.example.com/twitter-card.png">
<meta name="twitter:image:alt" content="Truth Hunters game interface showing claim evaluation">

findings.title: Missing Twitter Card image (twitter:image)
findings.description: No twitter:image meta tag is present for Twitter/X social sharing.
findings.impact: Links shared on Twitter/X will not display a preview image, reducing engagement significantly.
findings.remediation: Add twitter:image meta tag with appropriate image (1200x675px or 1:1 ratio depending on card type)
findings.recommended_implementation:
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://truthhunters.example.com/twitter-card.png">
<meta name="twitter:image:alt" content="Truth Hunters: The Calibration Game interface">

findings.title: Missing canonical URL
findings.description: No canonical link tag is present. Canonical URLs are critical for preventing duplicate content issues.
findings.impact: Search engines may index multiple versions of the same page (http/https, with/without www, with/without trailing slash), diluting SEO authority and causing ranking issues.
findings.remediation: Add canonical link tag to specify the preferred URL version

findings.title: No JSON-LD structured data implementation
findings.description: No Schema.org structured data is present. This is especially important for educational content to appear in rich search results.
findings.impact: Missing out on rich snippets in search results, reduced visibility in Google's educational content features, and lower CTR. Educational apps can benefit from SoftwareApplication, EducationalGame, or LearningResource schemas.
findings.remediation: Implement JSON-LD structured data for educational application
findings.recommended_implementation:
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "SoftwareApplication",
  "name": "Truth Hunters: The Calibration Game",
  "applicationCategory": "EducationalApplication",
  "operatingSystem": "Web Browser",
  "offers": {
    "@type": "Offer",
    "price": "0",
    "priceCurrency": "USD"
  },
  "description": "A research-backed educational game for middle schoolers to develop epistemic skills, AI error detection, and confidence calibration.",
  "educationalUse": "Critical Thinking, Media Literacy, AI Detection",
  "educationalLevel": "Middle School",
  "learningResourceType": "Game",
  "audience": {
    "@type": "EducationalAudience",
    "educationalRole": "student"
  },
  "inLanguage": "en",
  "author": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Truth Hunters"
  }
}
</script>

findings.title: Meta description length is optimal
findings.description: Meta description is 135 characters, which is within the recommended 120-160 character range.
findings.impact: Positive - description will display fully in search results without truncation.
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding
findings.code_snippet: <meta name="description" content="Truth Hunters: A research-backed game for middle schoolers to develop epistemic skills, AI error detection, and confidence calibration.">

findings.title: Title tag length is optimal
findings.description: Title tag is 35 characters, well within the recommended 50-60 character range.
findings.impact: Positive - title will display fully in search results without truncation.
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding

findings.title: Single H1 in noscript only - SPA dynamic content
findings.description: HTML has h1 only in noscript section. The actual h1 is rendered by React in the Header component.
findings.impact: Search engines can crawl JavaScript-rendered content, but static h1 in initial HTML is preferable for SEO. Modern search engines handle this well, but there's a minor SEO opportunity.
findings.current_state: H1 only present in noscript fallback, React renders h1 dynamically in Header component
findings.remediation: Consider server-side rendering (SSR) or static site generation (SSG) for better initial HTML, or ensure the h1 is quickly rendered
findings.code_snippet:
Truth Hunters: The Calibration Game

Truth Hunters

findings.title: Proper semantic HTML structure present
findings.description: The application uses semantic HTML elements including header[role='banner'], main[role='main'], and footer elements.
findings.impact: Positive - helps search engines and accessibility tools understand page structure.
findings.current_state: Semantic elements properly implemented in React components
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding

findings.title: Core meta tags properly implemented
findings.description: Charset (UTF-8), viewport, and language declaration (lang='en') are all properly set.
findings.impact: Positive - ensures proper rendering and search engine understanding.
findings.current_state: All core meta tags present and correct
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding

findings.title: Missing og:locale meta tag
findings.description: No og:locale tag to specify the language and region.
findings.impact: Social media platforms may not correctly identify the content language, potentially affecting international reach.
findings.remediation: Add og:locale meta tag

findings.title: Missing preload for critical resources
findings.description: No preload link tags for critical resources (fonts, CSS, JS) that could improve page load performance.
findings.impact: Slower initial page load can negatively affect Core Web Vitals and SEO rankings. Page speed is a confirmed ranking factor.
findings.current_state: Only preconnect tags present for Google Fonts
findings.remediation: Add preload tags for critical fonts and resources
findings.recommended_implementation:
<link rel="preload" href="/assets/js/main-[hash].js" as="script">
<link rel="preload" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/jetbrainsmono/v13/...woff2" as="font" type="font/woff2" crossorigin>
findings.code_snippet:
<!-- Current: Lines 32-34 -->
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=JetBrains+Mono:wght@400;600;700&family=Source+Serif+4:ital,wght@0,400;0,600;1,400&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">

findings.title: No image elements with alt attributes
findings.description: Application uses emoji characters and SVG data URIs instead of traditional img elements. No alt attributes needed as there are no img tags.
findings.impact: Neutral - while no images need alt text, this means missing opportunities for image SEO and Google Image Search visibility.
findings.current_state: No elements found in codebase, only emoji and inline SVG
findings.remediation: Consider if any visual elements should be actual images with proper alt text for image search SEO

findings.title: No hreflang tags for internationalization
findings.description: No hreflang tags present to indicate language/region variations. The project has i18next for internationalization but no hreflang tags.
findings.impact: If the app is translated to other languages in the future, search engines won't know about alternative language versions, limiting international reach.
findings.current_state: i18next package installed but no hreflang tags
findings.remediation: Add hreflang tags if/when multiple language versions are available
findings.recommended_implementation:
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="en" href="https://truthhunters.example.com/">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="es" href="https://truthhunters.example.com/?lang=es">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="x-default" href="https://truthhunters.example.com/">

findings.title: SPA fallback properly configured
findings.description: Netlify and Vercel configs properly handle SPA routing with 200 rewrites instead of 404s.
findings.impact: Positive - prevents broken links and ensures all routes are accessible to search engines.
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding

findings.title: Security headers properly configured
findings.description: Strong security headers (CSP, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options) are properly set.
findings.impact: Positive - security is a trust signal for search engines and users. HTTPS and security headers are minor ranking factors.
findings.current_state: Comprehensive security headers in netlify.toml and vercel.json
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding

findings.title: Code splitting and lazy loading implemented
findings.description: Vite config shows proper code splitting strategy with lazy-loaded components and optimized chunks.
findings.impact: Positive - improves page load performance and Core Web Vitals, which are SEO ranking factors.
findings.current_state: Manual chunks for vendor code, claims data, teacher dashboard, and leaderboard
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding

findings.title: CMS page lacks SEO optimization
findings.description: The CMS (Claims Manager) page at /cms/index.html has minimal SEO - only a title, no meta description, no Open Graph tags.
findings.impact: If the CMS page is public-facing, it will have poor search visibility and social sharing. If it's admin-only, it should be blocked from search engines.

findings.title: No dedicated 404 error page
findings.description: No custom 404 error page detected. The SPA redirect handles all routes, which is correct for the app, but a dedicated 404 for truly missing resources would improve UX and SEO.
findings.impact: Users and search engines encountering broken links get redirected to the main app instead of seeing a helpful 404 page. This can confuse crawlers.
findings.current_state: All routes redirect to index.html with status 200
findings.remediation: Consider implementing a proper 404 detection within the app for invalid routes
findings.recommended_implementation: Add a NotFound component in React that detects invalid routes and shows a 404 message with helpful links back to main pages

findings.title: Favicon using data URI SVG (no fallback)
findings.description: Favicon is implemented as an inline data URI SVG. No fallback favicon.ico or apple-touch-icon for older browsers and devices.
findings.impact: Modern browsers handle SVG favicons well, but some older browsers and iOS may not display the icon, affecting brand recognition in bookmarks and tabs.
findings.remediation: Add fallback favicon formats for broader compatibility
findings.recommended_implementation:
<link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="/favicon.svg">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" sizes="32x32" href="/favicon-32x32.png">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" sizes="16x16" href="/favicon-16x16.png">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" sizes="180x180" href="/apple-touch-icon.png">
findings.code_snippet:

findings.title: No web app manifest (manifest.json)
findings.description: No web app manifest file for PWA capabilities and 'Add to Home Screen' functionality.
findings.impact: Missing out on Progressive Web App benefits, which can improve user retention and engagement. Google considers PWA features a positive signal.
findings.remediation: Create a web app manifest for PWA support

findings.title: Missing Open Graph article metadata
findings.description: No article:published_time, article:modified_time, or article:author tags, though og:type is 'website' so these are not strictly required.
findings.impact: Minimal - these tags are more relevant for blog posts and articles. For a web app, they're not critical.
findings.current_state: og:type is 'website' (correct for a web app)
findings.remediation: Consider adding published_time for better social media freshness signals

findings.title: Teacher mode uses query parameter - not SEO-friendly URLs
findings.description: Teacher dashboard accessed via ?teacher=true query parameter. While functional, this is not ideal for SEO as it's not a separate, indexable page.
findings.impact: Search engines can index query parameter URLs, but clean URLs (/teacher) would be more SEO-friendly and shareable.
findings.remediation: Consider using a proper routing solution (React Router) with clean URLs like /teacher

findings.title: Good SEO metadata in package.json
findings.description: Package.json includes proper keywords, description, and repository information which helps with npm/GitHub discoverability.
findings.impact: Positive - helps developers find the project on npm and GitHub, improving overall discoverability.
findings.remediation: No action needed - this is a positive finding. Consider adding more specific keywords like 'misinformation', 'media-literacy', 'calibration'
